item.title: Instructions: June 1
item.author: shawn.graham@carleton.ca (Dr. Shawn Graham)
item.description: Telling the Compelling Story Eventually, after many cycles of cleaning data, making exploratory visualizations, and rerunning your analyzes, you will arrive at a point where you have this thing that you want to communicate. Perhaps it’s part of a larger story, and illuminates some aspect that was hitherto hidden. Perhaps it’s the entire story. Perhaps it only sets up the questions for a deeper investigation. There will come a moment when you want to communicate and tell this compelling story.

item.title: Posters
item.author: shawn.graham@carleton.ca (Dr. Shawn Graham)
item.description: ‘Accidental Renaissance: the photos that look like Italian paintings’. Here we’re going to explore some of the principles of design that are useful for you in the design of academic posters. These same principles are useful for the design of infographics. If an academic poster is the distillation of the same ideas that might turn up in an academic poster, then an infographic is a distillation of an academic poster.
